attributes.action: Boris Jonson to resign for his inability to handle covid-19 outbreak.
attributes.additional_details:
Boris Jonson has, ironically, washed his hands about the covid-19 outbreak by (1) ignoring it until only the late first week of March, (2) letting a figure like Chris Whitty decide what to do with the lives of people, (3) ignoring WHO guidances, (4) ignoring lessons learnt by other countries.

His actions have been irresponsible, he is not doing all he could, this is not what a PM does, this is what a careless monarch does.
attributes.background:
The Parliament must run a motion of confidence for Boris Jonson to be removed from his position as British PM. 

The Parliament must also ask for CMO Chris Whitty to be removed from his role for good.

rejection.details:
We can't publish petitions about appointments. That includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or to resign.
You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:
NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
